meanings.definition: A person who accompanies and looks after another person or group, especially young people.
meanings.sent1: The chaperons made sure the students stayed together during the field trip.
meanings.sent2: The school dance required several chaperons to supervise the students.
meanings.sent3: The chaperons joked with the kids to keep them entertained.
meanings.sent4: The chaperons were like guardian angels watching over the children.
meanings.sent5: The chaperons' presence provided a sense of security for the young campers.

meanings.definition: To accompany and look after another person or group, especially young people.
meanings.sent1: She chaperons her little brother to the park every weekend.
meanings.sent2: The teacher chaperons the students on the class trip.
meanings.sent3: He chaperons the group of kids with a watchful eye.
meanings.sent4: The babysitter chaperons the children with care and attention.
meanings.sent5: The camp counselor chaperons the campers during the hike.
